repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Two changes, which to large extent share implementation (as underlying infrastructure improvements are shared for external UI and TUI):

1) Deprecate `ext_wildmenu`. When both `ext_cmdline` and `ext_popupmenu` are set, use the popupmenu events also for cmdline completion. The `ext_wildmenu` events contained a strict subset of the information of `ext_popupmenu` and doesn't afford any expansion, as elements are strings and not structured. `ext_popupmenu` on the other hand prepares for future improvements like adding kind and info to items. Keep backwards compatibility, by translating back to `ext_wildmenu` events when this flag is also set.

2) Add `set wildoptions+=pum` flag to use the builtin vertical popupmenu instead of the horizontal statusline wildmenu. Inspired by  the CLPUM patch https://h-east.github.io/vim/, but this is much more limited in scope (and code size). While the CLPUM patch also concerns user definition of completion and enhanced competion behavior and config, this PR mostly only affects the display, still maintaining forward-compatibility with such improvements.

comment_data.body: a few lines up, the "Currently only one word is allowed" line can be deleted.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6605,6 +6605,8 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 			is displayed per line.  Often used tag kinds are:
 				d	#define
 				f	function
+	  pum		Display the completion matches using the popupmenu

comment_data.body: I would maybe parameterize `row`, `col`, and `pum_anchor_grid`, and then add a wrapper function `cmdline_pum_display()` in `ex_getln.c`, to avoid some of these decisions in `pum_display()`. Then I guess another wrapper is needed, `insert_pum_display()`. Maybe it's hopeless :)
These wrapper functions already exist, they are called `ins_compl_show_pum` and `ex_getln.c:showmatches`. So we can move the code there and remove the `if/else` here.

@justinmk Unfortunately this cannot work, `pum_set_selected` can change the window layout which causes `pum_display()` to be reexecuted (with an internal `do { } while(1)` ) so `ins_compl_show_pum` cannot precompute the positions.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -555,6 +555,24 @@ size_t mb_string2cells(const char_u *str)
   return clen;
 }
 
+/// Get the number of cells occupied by string `str` with maximum length `size`
+///
+/// @param str The source string, may not be NULL, must be a NUL-terminated
+///            string.
+/// @param size maximum length of string. It will terminate on earlier NUL.
+/// @return The number of cells occupied by string `str`
+size_t mb_string2cells_len(const char_u *str, size_t size)

comment_data.body:
can `utf_ptr2len_len` be used directly?

```suggestion
       p += utf_ptr2len_len(p, size+(p-str))) {
```

That would make it inconsistent from other mbyte functions, as well as causing a lot of unnecessary casts between different mbyte functions. If making mbyte functions `char *` is a goal, it would seem better with a dedicated PR for this with a well thought out design to minimise internal casts as well as reducing the risk of semantic errors.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -555,6 +555,24 @@ size_t mb_string2cells(const char_u *str)
   return clen;
 }
 
+/// Get the number of cells occupied by string `str` with maximum length `size`
+///
+/// @param str The source string, may not be NULL, must be a NUL-terminated
+///            string.
+/// @param size maximum length of string. It will terminate on earlier NUL.
+/// @return The number of cells occupied by string `str`
+size_t mb_string2cells_len(const char_u *str, size_t size)

comment_regular_data.body:
Added some user docs and tests. `ui.txt` docs still missing.

Compatibility note: this would break an 0.3.x UI that implements both `ext_popupmenu` and `ext_cmdline` and not `ext_wildmenu`. I think this is pretty rare/nonextistent, any UI that implemented the two first would reasonably have implemented `ext_wildmenu` as well.

The alternative would be to add another UI option but I would like to avoid too much proliferation of options. Though it would allow feature detection instead of checking the API level.

Found a crash with these steps:

```
nvim -u NORC +'set wildoptions=pum'
:e<tab>
[resize the host terminal while pum is displayed]

Assertion failed: (row < default_grid.Rows), function ui_comp_raw_line, file ../src/nvim/ui_compositor.c, line 415.                    
```

Note:   height of the pum doesn't seem to matter.
@justinmk Fixed the crash. popupmenu will also be properly redrawn on resize, unlike horizontal wildmenu which just disappears..

> Unrelated failure (presumably), though only in free_all_mem build:

Known issue https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/8813

+1, this seems to be an objectively better layout.
@justinmk / @bfredl Can we make this the default?
@ilAYAli Glad you like it. But lets get it merged first and tried by the general community before we think about defaults :)

Hey @bfredl, how do I tell Neovim what size my popup menu is?

Normally, in `CompleteChange` vim.v.event gives this,

```lua
{
  col = 5,
  completed_item = vim.empty_dict(),
  height = 3,
  row = 22,
  scrollbar = false,
  size = 3,
  width = 15
}
```

After I use `vim.ui_attach()` with `ext_popupmenu = true` I get this,

```lua
{
  col = 0, -- This should be 5
  completed_item = vim.empty_dict(),
  height = 3,
  row = 22,
  scrollbar = false,
  size = 3,
  width = 0 -- This should be 10
}
```

Is there a way to make Neovim show the actual width & col?
Ask on #matrix; don't necrobump ancient PRs.

title: UI: deprecate redundant ext_wildmenu events and allow TUI popupmenu for cmdline
